intro: Marianthemum barbatum, commonly known as the beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the plantain family (Plantaginaceae) and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and spikes of tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to purple, attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Marianthemum barbatum is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
